name: Adlai Carrot Fried Rice
description: This Adlai Carrot Fried Rice is a perfect harmony of health and taste, ideal for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. Infused with wholesome ingredients like Adlai Rice, fresh carrots, and coconut, it's a healthy twist to your traditional fried rice that does not compromise on flavor. A great addition to your healthy recipes collection, this dish is packed with nutrients and easily fits into your health-conscious lifestyle.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and dice the carrots into small pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the egg into a bowl, beating it lightly with a fork.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add the coconut. Wait until it is hot, then add the diced carrots. Cook for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Push the carrots to one side of the pan, and pour in the beaten egg on the other side. Let it set for a minute before scrambling it and mixing with the carrots.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the pan. Season with salt. Stir everything together and cook for an additional 5 minutes, making sure the rice is heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
